ext_description.p: A Cable_usage_view is a type of . A Cable_usage_view may provide detailed assembly data including location and orientation of connectors and location of cable centreline and junctions using geometric models that are annotation models.
ext_description.note: The Cable_usage_view supports intellectual property protection. A design organization can control the amount of data they provide to a licensee or purchaser by including only a specifically tailored set of data in a usage view.

Shape information is provided by or by . Shape of connector is provided by Assembly_component_2d_shape or by Assembly_component_3d_shape. Shape of centreline curve is provided by annotated curve or by solid curve.
ext_description.example: This data can include the information currently included in an interface control drawing (ICD).
The data in a Cable_usage_view does not include details of the cross-section wiring arrangement.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: A Cable_terminal is a type of . A Cable_terminal is a mapping of an instance of to specify an interface terminal for a cable. This mapping is maintained entirely in the Cable usage view. If available, the terminal_connection_zone shall be supplied. The mapping provides support for establishing end-to-end continuity specification for a Cable.

the terminal_connection_zone specifies a for the Cable_terminal. There may be more than one for a Cable_terminal. The terminal_connection_zone is optional and need not be supplied. If the data is available in the source system, it shall be supplied.
